description: Congressional leaders have agreed on a short-term spending deal to keep the federal government open for nearly three months. Lawmakers are facing an Oct. 1 deadline to get the new bill passed to avert a partial government shutdown. CBS News congressional correspondent Nikole Killion has the details.
title: What's in the latest government funding bill?

description: The FBI revealed Monday that the suspect arrested in connection with the apparent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump left a handwritten letter months before the incident. In it he wrote, "This was an assassination attempt on Donald Trump." CBS News national correspondent Manuel Bojorquez reports.
title: FBI says suspect claimed "assassination attempt on Donald Trump" in note

description: Sources say former President Donald Trump will hold a rally at the Butler Farm Show fairgrounds on Oct. 5, where a gunman shot at him and grazed his ear on July 13. Vice President Kamala Harris is expected to focus on the economy and foreign policy this week as a new CBS News poll finds her up four points nationally. CBS News' Aaron Navarro and Libby Cathey have the latest.
title: Trump to rally at site of 1st assassination attempt in Pennsylvania

description: Lawyers for Marcellus Williams, who maintains his innocence, argued Monday the execution should be halted over the exclusion of a potential Black juror.
title: Marcellus Williams' execution set to proceed, Missouri Supreme Court rules

description: Donald Trump will return for a rally to the site of his first assassination attempt in Butler, Pennsylvania.
title: Trump to rally at site of 1st assassination attempt in Butler, Pennsylvania

description: Why wait until October Prime Day? We picked out Amazon's best deals under $50 that you can shop today.
title: Best early Amazon October Prime Day deals under $50

description: Global money transfer service is working to get back online days after detecting a problem and taking its systems down.
title: MoneyGram goes offline as it investigates cybersecurity problem

description: Changing Nebraska's electoral vote allocation to winner-take-all would almost certainly have benefited former President Donald Trump this fall.
title: Nebraska Republican rejects push to change Electoral College system to help Trump

description: A CBS News analysis of satellite imagery indicates Russia's recent ICBM launch failed. It's the latest in a string of Russian nuclear weapon tests this year.
title: Russia's test launch of ICBM known as Satan II appears to have failed

description: Some United Nations General Assembly discussions will focus on climate solutions as Climate Week NYC gets underway. CBS News national environmental correspondent David Schechter has more.
title: United Nations General Assembly focus on climate solutions

description: At the State Capitol, CBS News California found that Democrats get more money from big oil than Republicans. And unlike their D.C. counterparts, Democrats in the California statehouse often vote against environmental legislation.
title: Meet the California Democrats getting money from Big Oil and voting against environmental laws

description: The Food and Drug Administration has approved a "self-administered" influenza vaccine that could be available by next year's flu season. Dr. Roy Gulick, an infectious disease specialist at New York-Presbyterian Hospital, joins CBS News with more.
title: Self-administered flu vaccine spray approved by FDA

description: Officials are still seeking suspects in the mass shooting at a popular Birmingham, Alabama, area where four died and at least 17 were injured. CBS News' Cristian Benavides has the latest.
title: Latest news on Birmingham deadly mass shooting

description:
When California lawmakers, especially Democrats, accept oil money or vote against seemingly climate-friendly bills, they are often criticized or accused of being beholden to the oil industry. 

But are they? 

We followed the oil money, analyzed the votes, and tracked down some of the lawmakers accused of "prioritizing the interests of the oil and gas industry."
title: Meet the California Democrats getting money from Big Oil

description: The Fed rate decisions are just one factor that drives mortgage rates. Here's what else can have an impact.
title: 6 things that impact mortgage interest rates (besides the Fed)

description: A developing weather system could strengthen in the Gulf of Mexico and become a tropical storm or hurricane that slams the South. CBS News Bay Area meteorologist Jessica Burch has more.
title: Weather system could become hurricane slamming South

description: There's a strong argument to be made for using a debt relief service this October. Here's what to consider now.
title: Should you consider debt relief this October?

description: After a report alleged North Carolina's Mark Robinson, GOP candidate for governor, years ago posted racist comments on a porn website, he lost a number of his staff, and ad buys for him won't be renewed.
title: GOP nominee for governor in NC bleeds staff, ad buys after report of racist comments

description: Yuval Siman Tov says his instincts helped him survive the October 7 Hamas attack at the "Tribe of Nova" music festival. He is featured in the new documentary "We Will Dance Again," by Yariv Mozer, about the attack.
title: October 7 attack survivor on instincts during rampage

description: CBS News environmental correspondent David Schechter explores the disconnect between voters and their elected officials on climate change issues with the help of reporting from our CBS News stations around the country.
title: Examining disconnect between politics and climate across the country

description: Lenders are already lowering rates on some products, providing savings to borrowers. Here's what to know.
title: Here are the credit products already cheaper after the Fed's rate cut

description: A third of former football players who played between 1960 and 2020 say they believe they have chronic traumatic encephalopathy, according to a new study. Dr. Rachel Grashow, director of epidemiological research initiatives with the Football Players Health Study at Harvard University, joins CBS News with top takeaways from her research.
title: Football players report they believe they have CTE for study

description: Ryan Wesley Routh, identified as the suspect found outside of Trump's golf course, was denied bond on Monday on two gun charges.
title: Feds say they will seek charge of attempted assassination against Trump golf course suspect

description: Vice President Kamala Harris says she wants a second debate against former President Donald Trump. CBS News campaign reporter Nidia Cavazos has more as a new CBS News poll shows Harris slightly ahead of Trump nationwide and in battleground states.
title: Harris says she wants second debate as new poll shows her ahead nationwide

description: Florida's Gulf Coast is bracing for the potential of a significant hurricane landfall later this week, as a possible tropical storm that could ultimately become Hurricane Helene is organizing in the Caribbean.
title: Florida eyeing storm that could become Hurricane Helene

description: A tired face with bags under its eyes is among eight new emoji set to appear on smartphones and computers next year.
title: Emoji lineup soon to include one that speaks for the weary masses

description: Cooling interest rates could spur homebuyers to enter the market. Here's what they should think about before they do.
title: 3 mortgage questions buyers should ask themselves now

description: Kmart will shutter its last big-box store in the U.S. in October, marking the end of an era for the 62-year-old discount chain.
title: Kmart to close its last remaining store in the U.S. Here's where it is.

description: Ahmad Alissa was charged with shooting and killing 10 people at the South Table Mesa King Soopers on March 22, 2021.
title: Verdict reached in Boulder grocery store shooting trial

description: President Biden meets with UAE president; Israeli airstrikes targeting Hezbollah in Lebanon kill nearly 300, injure over 1,000.
title: 9/23: CBS News 24/7 Episode 2

description: The House of Representatives will vote on a measure to fund the government and avert a shutdown. CBS News congressional correspondent Nikole Killion breaks down how House Speaker Mike Johnson obtained support from Democratic leadership.
title: House voting on plan to avert government shutdown

description: New York City is hosting world leaders at the United Nations General Assembly, where President Biden, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy are among those speaking. CBS News national security contributor Sam Vinograd has more.
title: Biden, Netanyahu and Zelenskyy expected at United Nations General Assembly

description: Former President Donald Trump says it is too late to have another debate against Kamala Harris. The vice president has said she wants to debate Trump again. CBS News' Libby Cathey has the latest on the 2024 presidential election.
title: Why Trump says it's too late for another Harris debate

description: The Fed cut rates last week, but it may not provide enough relief for those facing high-rate credit card debt.
title: Credit card debt forgiveness could make sense this October. Here's why.

description: Ryan Wesley Routh has been denied bail and must remain in custody until his trial. Routh faces charges stemming from an apparent assassination attempt against former President Donald Trump in Florida. CBS News' Manuel Bojorquez reports.
title: Trump apparent assassination attempt suspect denied bail in Florida

description: The independent presidential candidate ended his campaign in August and endorsed former President Donald Trump.
title: RFK Jr. asks Supreme Court to restore his name on New York's ballot

description: What to know about the "optimal time" to get vaccinated against the flu — and how the FluMist nasal spray stacks up to the traditional shot.
title: When should you get the flu shot? A doctor weighs in on best timing, options.

description: Reports are emerging of airstrikes in Beirut after a barrage of missiles launched into southern Lebanon Monday morning apparently killed more than 270 people. Lina Sinjab with BBC News, a CBS News partner, has more from Beirut on Israel's operation targeting Hezbollah.
title: Israel strikes in Beirut reported after hundreds killed in morning Lebanon operation

description: Walmart's Holiday Deals event starts on the same day as Amazon's October Prime Day sale​ but lasts even longer.
title: Walmart is throwing a rival Amazon Prime Day sale in October

description: Walmart's Holiday Deals event starts on the same day as Amazon's October Prime Day sale​ but lasts even longer.
title: Walmart is throwing a rival Amazon Prime Day sale in October

description: The first and only vice presidential debate takes place Oct. 1 and will be broadcast on CBS.
title: Here's who's standing in for Vance and Walz in VP debate prep

description: Five of the 12 Tufts University men's lacrosse players are still in the hospital following a workout with a Navy SEAL trainee last week.
title: What is rhabdomyolysis? The condition that hospitalized 12 Tufts athletes

description: The industry data and analytics company Luminate said the music mogul's music saw an average 18.3% increase in on-demand streams.
title: Sean "Diddy" Combs' music streams jump after indictment

description: The price of gold is continuing its upward trajectory — and there are a few reasons to consider buying in now.
title: Gold's price surges past $2,600. Here's why you should invest now.

description: Billionaire philanthropist Bill Gates and musician Jon Batiste discuss their recent trip to Nigeria and how simple actions can help combat hunger.
title: Bill Gates, Jon Batiste on combating child malnutrition

description: Israel targets over 300 Hezbollah targets in Lebanon strikes; Port workers from Texas to New Jersey threaten to strike.
title: 9/23: CBS News 24/7 Episode 1

description: After misplacing $500 from a football pool win, Greg Thow got a life-changing call from a woman who spent months searching for him to return the lost money.
title: Stranger spent 5 months searching for person who lost $500: "It wasn't mine."

description: Less than 10% of plastics in the U.S. are recycled.
title: California lawsuit alleges Exxon misled consumers about plastics recycling

description: The government has already disbursed more than 900 million free at-home COVID-19 tests, and is reopening its free test kit portal.
title: Free COVID-19 tests are back for fall 2024. Here's how to get them.

description: While the lead in Stanley Quenchers is unlikely to cause harm, there are lead-free water bottles available.
title: The best lead-free Stanley cup alternatives

description: Officials in Birmingham, Alabama, are asking for information from the public on suspects behind a mass shooting Sunday where four died and at least 17 others were injured. CBS News' Cristian Benavides has the latest.
title: $100,000 reward for information on Birmingham shooting

description: Japan's defense minister said the use of flares was a legitimate response to airspace violation and "we plan to use it without hesitation."
title: Japan scrambles flare-shooting jets to warn Russian spy plane

description: Find out how to watch the Jacksonville Jaguars vs. Buffalo Bills "Monday Night Football" game tonight.
title: How to watch the Jaguars vs. Bills NFL game on MNF tonight

description: Israel carried out widespread missile strikes overnight in Lebanon in the latest in a series of attacks against the militant group Hezbollah. It comes after Hezbollah sent dozens of rockets into northern Israel over the weekend.
title: Israel strikes Lebanon in latest series of attacks aimed at Hezbollah

description: Former President Donald Trump says he will not run again in 2028 if he loses the 2024 election. This comes as Vice President Kamala Harris raises millions at a fundraising event in New York. CBS News' Nidia Cavazos and Caitlin Huey-Burns reports.
title: Harris fundraising update, Trump on running again if he loses 2024 election

description: 60 Minutes correspondent Bill Whitaker breaks down how fentanyl has been spreading through the U.S., quickly becoming America's worst drug crisis. Whitaker visited the border with Mexico to see how fentanyl is being brought into the country.
title: Fentanyl fuels worst drug crisis in U.S. history

description: Speaker Mike Johnson says the House of Representatives is set to vote on a stopgap measure that would keep the government open until December. CBS News congressional correspondent Scott MacFarlane has more on Democratic support for the bill.
title: Speaker Johnson says House will vote on new funding bill

description: A HELOC comes with a variable interest rate, which could help borrowers now that interest rates have been cut.
title: How much would a $50,000 HELOC cost per month now that rates are cut?

description: Lebanon is saying at least 182 people were killed by new Israeli airstrikes that reportedly hit around 300 sites, apparently targeting the Hezbollah militant group. CBS News' Holly Williams has the latest.
title: Lebanon says Israel strikes killed almost 200 people

description: Vice President Kamala Harris appears to be gaining support among voters who think the economy is doing well, according to a new CBS News poll. CBS News politics reporter Zak Hudak has more on the trend.
title: Kamala Harris gaining support on economy, new CBS News poll shows

description: A drought has dried up Ecuador's hydroelectric power capacity, prompting four consecutive overnight blackouts to conserve energy.
title: Ecuador imposes overnight blackouts as drought saps hydroelectric power

description: Vice President Kamala Harris says she still wants another debate against Donald Trump, but the former president says it is too late since some states are already holding early voting. CBS News' Libby Cathey has more.
title: Kamala Harris pushes for another Donald Trump debate

description: Violent crime and property crime decreased in 2023, according to data released by the FBI on Monday, while the year saw a rise in car thefts.
title: FBI report shows decrease in violent crime, increase in vehicle theft in 2023

description: Experts predict mortgage rates could see a big drop by the end of the year. Here's what to expect.
title: Here's how far mortgage rates could drop before the end of 2024

description: CBS poll: Kamala Harris up four points nationally; Kate Middleton makes first public appearance since completing chemotherapy.
title: 9/23: CBS Morning News

description: The Soyuz landing in Kazakhstan sets the stage for launch of a SpaceX Crew Dragon flight to the space station Thursday.
title: 2 cosmonauts, NASA astronaut return to Earth after marathon mission

description: Mortgage rates could keep falling, but it depends on the Fed — and other factors.
title: What's the mortgage interest rate forecast for October 2024?

description: While polar bears are a protected species in Iceland and it's forbidden to kill one at sea, they can be killed if they pose a threat to humans.
title: Rare polar bear spotted on shores in Iceland shot dead by police

description: Israel is apparently targeting Hezbollah missiles hidden in residential buildings in Lebanon, warning some residents to evacuate before potential strikes. CBS News' Chris Livesay reports from Tel Aviv.
title: Israel warns Lebanon residents to evacuate before strikes against Hezbollah

description: Guillermo Sohnlein helped found OceanGate with Stockton Rush, who was among the five people who died when the Titan submersible imploded.
title: Titan company co-founder says goal was to create fleet of subs

description: Former President Donald Trump is headed to several battleground states, including  Pennsylvania, Michigan and Georgia. CBS News campaign reporter Olivia Rinaldi has more on Trump's proposals and upcoming campaign events.
title: Trump to Pennsylvania, Michigan and Georgia

description: New CBS News polling shows Vice President Kamala Harris slightly ahead of former President Donald Trump nationally. Harris also has a small edge over Trump in battleground states. CBS News elections and surveys executive director Anthony Salvanto breaks down the data, and CBS News campaign reporter Zak Hudak has more on Harris' next campaign moves.
title: New poll shows Harris up four points ahead of Trump nationally, edge ahead in battlegrounds

description: Nearly one year after the Oct. 7 attack by Hamas, the new documentary, "We Will Dance Again," tells the stories of survivors from the Nova Music Festival, including those who fled and those who were wounded.
title: Documentary "We Will Dance Again" shares survival stories from Nova Music Festival attack

description: Law Roach, the fashion visionary behind unforgettable looks worn by Zendaya, Celine Dion and Naomi Campbell, joins "CBS Mornings" to discuss his new book and how he shapes red carpet moments.
title: Stylist Law Roach talks crafting iconic looks for Zendaya, Celine Dion

description: New data shows that the months of June, July and August were the warmest on record globally. The warming climate is tied to more deadly heat waves, destructive wildfires and stronger hurricanes. Meteorologist Stephanie Abrams with The Weather Channel explains.
title: Summer months were warmest on record globally, data shows

description: Commerce Department says it is taking proactive steps to keep Chinese and Russian-manufactured technologies off American roads.
title: Biden proposes ban on Chinese and Russian software in U.S. cars

description: After finding an envelope of cash, Karla Montgomery made it her mission to find the owner. Five months later, she found him changing both of their lives. CBS correspondent David Begnaud has more.
title: 5-month search to return lost $500 leads to unlikely friendship

description: Federal officials are raising concerns about a possible link between declining vaccination rates and a surge in pediatric flu deaths. Dr. Celine Gounder, a CBS News medical contributor, has more.
title: CDC warns drop in vaccinations may be tied to rise in pediatric flu deaths

description: Ryan Wesley Routh, the suspect who was arrested in connection with the apparent assassination attempt on Trump, was charged with two federal firearms offenses.
title: Suspect claimed "assassination attempt on Donald Trump," FBI says

description: After over 70 years apart, Luis Albino was reunited with his family after a DNA test revealed his identity, closing a kidnapping case that had gone cold for decades.
title: Kidnapped as a 6-year-old in 1951, man is finally reunited with family

description: Only on "CBS Mornings," billionaire philanthropist Bill Gates and award-winning musician Jon Batiste, talk about their recent trip to Nigeria to combat hunger and bring attention to the growing crisis of global malnutrition.
title: Philanthropist Bill Gates and musician Jon Batiste team up to fight global hunger

description: Search teams are looking for Austin King, a 22-year-old concession worker at Yellowstone National Park who went missing on a backcountry trip.
title: Search launched for Yellowstone worker missing in remote part of park

description: Israel and Hezbollah launch more attacks against each other, raising fears of an all-out war. Also, a massive manhunt is underway in Alabama after gunmen shoot at least 20 people outside a Birmingham club. All that and all that matters in today's Eye Opener.
title: Eye Opener: Israel and Hezbollah launch more attacks against each other

description: Most Americans have a dollar figure in mind for what they would need to earn to stop fretting about making ends meet.
title: Here's how much money Americans think they need to make to stop worrying

description: The Tufts University men's lacrosse team put practices on hold as at least 12 players recover from rhabdomyolysis or "rhabdo." Physiologist and anesthesiologist Dr. Michael Joyner says the rare condition can happen after a very intense workout.
title: Tufts University lacrosse players diagnosed with rare muscle condition after team workout

description: A mass shooting outside of a cigar lounge in Birmingham, Alabama, left at least four people dead and 17 others injured. Police are calling it a "targeted hit" and believe multiple shooters opened fire.
title: Search for suspects after mass shooting in Birmingham, Alabama

description: Brook Cheuvront was reported missing on Saturday after a tracking app she was using stopped updating and friends could not reach her.
title: Missing American hiker found dead on South Africa's Table Mountain

description: The uptick in violence comes after the surprise arrest on U.S. soil of Sinaloa Cartel co-founder Ismael "El Mayo" Zambada in July.
title: Corpses found wearing sombreros as Mexico cartel violence rages

description: More 70 years later, Luis Armando Albino has been found thanks to help from an online ancestry test, old photos and newspaper clippings.
title: Boy abducted from California park in 1951 found alive on East Coast

description: Jane Fonda spoke with CBS News about why she joined the fight: "This isn't just about the environment. This is about the whole planet."
title: Jane Fonda on climate activism, 2024 election: "We can't lose another 4 years"

description: Actor and activist Jane Fonda sat down with CBS News national environmental correspondent David Schechter to talk about her commitment to fighting climate change, why young voters are so important in 2024, and how she views her role as a celebrity activist. See more of her interview on "CBS Saturday Morning" on Sept. 28.
title: Jane Fonda on her climate activism and message for young voters: "Show us your power!"

description: Lebanese officials say at least 50 people have been killed as Israel warns residents it's targeting Hezbollah weapons hidden in homes.
title: Dozens reportedly killed as Israel says it's bombing Hezbollah weapons

description: State Surgeon General Joseph Ladapo spread anti-vaccine misinformation by telling Floridians to avoid mRNA vaccines. Vaccine experts and historians can't remember another state health leader urging residents to avoid an FDA-approved vaccine.
title: Florida's new COVID booster guidance is straight-up misinformation

description: The Major League Baseball Players Association says Dick Moss, who revolutionized pay for professional athletes, has died at the age of 93 in California.
title: Dick Moss, lawyer behind free agency for baseball players, dies at 93

description: 4 dead, 17 wounded in Alabama shooting; Mini train park in Oregon still going 70 years on
title: 9/22: CBS Weekend News
